Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Competitive \Com*pet"i*tive\, a. Of or pertaining to competition; producing competition; competitory; as, a competitive examination. [1913 Webster]

competitive adj 1: involving competition or competitiveness; "competitive games"; "to improve one's competitive position" [syn: {competitory}] [ant: {noncompetitive}] 2: subscribing to capitalistic competition [syn: {free-enterprise(a)}, {private-enterprise(a)}] 3: showing a fighting disposition without self-seeking; "highly competitive sales representative"; "militant in fighting for better wages for workers"; "his self-assertive and ubiquitous energy" [syn: {militant}]
